intro: Crotalaria hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. It has compound leaves and produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ornamental value and potential ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
